attributes.action: Why can Jacob Rees-Mogg change his position on Brexit, but the UK public can’t
attributes.background:
July 2018 Rees-Mogg refers to May’s Brexit deal as “worse than no deal”. December he calls for May to “resign”. 
Yesterday he said he may support May’s deal, if he can go from calling for to resign because of her deal to supporting it, how can anyone deny the public the right to change their mind?

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
